intro: Tinospora sagittata var. yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan Tinospora, is a climbing shrub native to China, particularly Yunnan Province. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces woody, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its ornamental value and traditional medicinal uses, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
